did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Sallie and Stephen Fisher Travel Diaries 1940-1950

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before reproducing or quoting from any materials, in whole or in part, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sallie and Stephen Fisher Travel Diaries, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Special Collections Research Center on 02/21/2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Sallie Fisher and her husband Stephen are listed in the Amish genealogy book "Descendants of Christian Fisher and Other Amish Mennonite Pioneer Families."  Stephen Fisher was born in 1890 and died in 1976.  He was the son of Elias M. Fisher and Malinda King. The wife, Sallie Zook, was born also born in 1890 and she died in 1970.  Further information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki: http://scrc.swem.wm.edu/wiki/index.php/Sallie Fisher.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following description was provided by the seller:"These two manuscript travel diaries present detailed information about Amish communities throughout the United States in the 1940s and 1950. The diaries were written by a middle-age Amish couple from Honey Brook and Ronks, Pennsylvania: Stephen King Fisher and Sallie L. Fisher. "People he visited in the Amish communities of Somerset County, Pennsylvania, near the towns of Springs, and Myersdale: Bennie A. Fisher and Annie Kinsinger Fisher, Mattie Wenger Kinsinger, Tilly Summy, Bishop Joe Yoder and Lizzie Schrock Yoder, Henry Kinsinger and Jemima Zook Kinsinger, Sam Zook and Sevilla Kinsinger Zook, Noah Kinsinger and Sarah Yoder Kinsinger, Clarence Bender and Alice Yoder Bender, Jacob Zook and Annie Bender Zook, Enos Zook and Ida Bontrager Zook, Preacher Dave Schrock and Matttie Stutzman Schrock, Harvey Bontrager and Lean Kiem Bontrager, Joe Bontrager from Iowa, Jake Stutzman and Emma Bontrager Stutzman, John Kiem and Lizzie Stutzman Kiem, Amos Fry and Sarah Ann Yoder Fry, Crist Yoder, Bishop Feltz Yoder and Lydia Bontrager Yoder, Reacher Dave K. Bontrager, etc. "People he visited at Oakland, Lawrence County, Pennsylvania: Preacher Dan Swartzentruber and Lydia Beachey Swartzentruber, Ira Yoder and Mary Yoder, Bishop Lewis Beachy and Annie Beachey, Noah Lichty and Ada Bender Lichty, Simon Swartzentruber and Daisy Yoder Swartzentruber, Noah Beachey and Katie Schrock Beachey, Noah Schrock and Cora Burkholder Schrock, etc. "People he visited at Grantsville, Maryland: Joel Zook, Amos J. Yoder and Amanda Kinsinger Yoder, Noah Beachey, Preacher Leff Yoder and Fannie Thomas Yoder, Joe Helmuth and Katie Beachey Yoder, Crist Yoder and Lizzie Schrock Yoder, Sam Schrock and Lydia Schrock, Enos Knepp and AdaYoder Knepp, Moses Miller and Edna Stutzman, Tobe Troyer from LaGrange, Sam Petersheim and Lizzie Blank Petersheim, Eli Schrock and Lena Hostetler Schrock, Eli Beachey and Lydia Kurtz Beachey, Lewis Yoder and Lizzie Beachey Yoder, Bennie Fisher, Sol Hochstetler and Lena Yoder Hoshstetler, Andy Deiner and Barbara Mast Deiner, Widow Effie Yoder, Widow Olive Breneman, etc. "People he visited in Mifflin County, Pennsylvania near Lewistown, Reedsville, etc: Dan Miller, Eli J. Bontrager, Bishop John A. Yoder and Barbara Yoder, Jonas Yoder and Anna Yoder, Mose Mast and Lydia Mast, Clarence Yoder, Preacher Benedict Yoder, Mary Ann Bontrager, John J. Yoder and Annie Bontrager Yoder, Noah Yoder and Lizzie Peachey Yoder, Dan Gingerich and Lydia Bender Gingerich, John Zook and Emma Byler Zook, Preacher Abraham Peachey and Nancy Yoder Peachey, Noah Hochstetler and Mattie King Hochstetler, Dan Peachey, Rufus Peachey and Mary Beiler Peachey, Mrs. Rebecca Renno Peachey, Ben Peachey and Sarah Kauffman Peachey, Dave Peachey and Lizzie Peachey, Noah Detweiler and Sarah Yoder, David Swarey and Annie Peachey Swarey, etc. "Travel to Pikes Peak and Colorado Springs and then to Hutchinson, Kansas: People he visited in Hutchinson, Kansas: Noah D. Mast and Barbara Stutzman Mast, Fred Bontrager and Katie Bontrager, Eli Helmuth and Katie Yoder Helmuth, etc. "People he visited in Washington, Iowa and Kalona, Iowa: Deacon Jake Byler and Leah Yoder Byler, Jonas Kanagy and Mollie Hochstetler Kanagy, Bishop Crist Byler and Katie Byler, Jake Kanagy and Lena Peachy Kanagy, etc."People he visited in Fort Wayne, Indiana and La Grange, Indiana: Enos Glick, Bishop Sam Lehman and Annie Miller Lehman, Rudy Yoder , Jonas Weaver, Johnas D. Mast, Enos Glick, Annie Troyer, etc. Plus people he visited in Dover, Delaware and people he visited in Holmes County, Ohio."
